intro: Elsholtzia pseudocristata f. miyasiroana, commonly known as the Miasiroan elsholtzia, is a rare and distinctive plant species native to specific regions in China. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and clustered in whorls. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
